title.rendered: Do You Have a Lash Extension Plan?

content.rendered:
Are you one of those people who likes to make decisions based on a whim? Do you detest planning, and prefer to live life in a more adventurous, “flying-by-the-seat-of-your-pants sort of way? Let’s face it; many of us have done things with a certain degree of spontaneity – and we’ve almost all lived to regret some of those decisions! Well, if you’re finally ready to get your first set of eyelash extensions, keep this advice in mind: make sure you have a lash extension plan.

But what does that mean, you might ask? The answer is surprisingly simple. Rather than just rush out to get your extension application, consider everything that’s involved with that process. Because, like it or not, one fact is inescapable: your decision to opt for perfect lashes is one of the most momentous beauty choices that you can make.

Choosing Your Lash Extension Salon

The most important decision that you will make involves your choice of salon. While it might be tempting to assume that all salons are created equal, that’s just not the case. To ensure the best and safest results, you should choose a lash salon that is staffed by highly trained, fully licensed technicians. That’s the best way to ensure that your lashes will be cared for by true professionals committed to upholding the highest level of industry best practices.

Choosing Your Look

Now that you’ve chosen a salon, the next step is to think about the look that you’re trying to achieve. Do you want something minimalist – maybe an option that just fills in some of the sparser areas of your lash line? Or maybe you want a more dramatic, movie star aesthetic that makes you stand out in the crowd? Whatever your choice, make sure that you have the healthy lashes needed to support the application. Consult with your lash technician to find out which lash type, length, and weight is right for your unique lash needs.

Learning About Aftercare

Of course, there’s more to lash extensions than just getting them. You also need to wear them – and that means that you need to be prepared to take care of them for the several months that they’ll be part of your life. You will need to wash them regularly, avoid extreme heat and humidity, and learn to avoid sleeping on your face. You may even want to consider a plan to get periodic refills to keep them looking full and vibrant. Remember, one or more lashes will fall out naturally every day, and that can eventually leave gaps in your perfect lashes. Refills can keep them looking great at all times!

The bottom line is simple: don’t leap into lash extensions without first looking at your options. Learn what you need to know and make sure that you have a lash extension plan in place to help you get the most out of this wonderful beauty enhancement. The right salon, the right look, and the right aftercare regimen are sure to make your extension experience a true success!
